channel.title: PI - Switching Interfaces - Help appreciated
channel.description:
--------------------------------------------------------- [img]http://i.imgur.com/goFZVKX.jpg[/img]
Ok, so i want to change this interface I want to keep the text color, but the interface makes it kind of annoying to read. So what i was thinking was that i could change the interface instead to perhaps a darker one, so it would be easier to read. But i havnt had any success yet, so any help will be appreciated! :)

item.title: PI - Switching Interfaces - Help appreciated
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Andersmulle2, post:9, topic:539837”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=658681.msg4405851#msg4405851 date=1391960162]
I told you on IRC. When you change the interface you will also need to update the lines on that interface, interfaces do not share the same text lines. I linked you to Lin’s interface editor on IRC, download that and use it to find your new interface and thus its text lines.
[/quote]
1st, the editor came up with an error it wouldnt even run.
2nd, i have the text lines, but the interface i chose comes up blank anyways.[/quote]You clearly don’t have the right ones, by the way the editor requires the .NET 4.0 framework, try downloading that.

Read full topic

item.title: PI - Switching Interfaces - Help appreciated
item.dc:creator: @Andersmulle2 Andersmulle2
item.description:
@Andersmulle2 wrote:

Pure_:

I told you on IRC. When you change the interface you will also need to update the lines on that interface, interfaces do not share the same text lines. I linked you to Lin’s interface editor on IRC, download that and use it to find your new interface and thus its text lines.

1st, the editor came up with an error it wouldnt even run.
2nd, i have the text lines, but the interface i chose comes up blank anyways.

Read full topic

@pure2ownage wrote:

I told you on IRC. When you change the interface you will also need to update the lines on that interface, interfaces do not share the same text lines. I linked you to Lin’s interface editor on IRC, download that and use it to find your new interface and thus its text lines.

item.title: PI - Switching Interfaces - Help appreciated
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

[quote=“Andersmulle2, post:5, topic:539837”][quote author=CoderOops link=topic=658681.msg4405657#msg4405657 date=1391902713]

Just go into client.java server sided, find the text and replace the interface id.

1st of all, that would be in commands.java.
2nd of all, I have tryed that and the interface came up blank without the text.
But as soon as i did ::interface followed by the old interface id used, the text came up.
So I’m thinking that it has to be edited more than one place.

1: depends how u want to open it. anyways main point you know where it is.
2: you can try that with opening 1 shop and then shop interface id with ::interface. It is just common PI bug, so try not to think about it.

Anyways OP:
Search for another interface that you want add with list from google or somewhere and test them with ::interface until u find good looking which you want to use.
then just swap the id and you’re done.

[/quote]
I thought that i just explained myself above ^
When i just change the interface id, that it is supposed to open in commands.java for the ::news command. The interface i changed it to comes up blank without text.[/quote]

Then you’re obviously doing something wrong…

anyways, to continue, show us code you’re modifying etc so we can actually help you if you can’t do it.

Read full topic

item.title: PI - Switching Interfaces - Help appreciated
item.dc:creator: @Andersmulle2 Andersmulle2
item.description:
@Andersmulle2 wrote:

[quote=“CoderOops, post:4, topic:539837”][quote author=Andersmulle2 link=topic=658681.msg4405646#msg4405646 date=1391899469]

Just go into client.java server sided, find the text and replace the interface id.

1st of all, that would be in commands.java.
2nd of all, I have tryed that and the interface came up blank without the text.
But as soon as i did ::interface followed by the old interface id used, the text came up.
So I’m thinking that it has to be edited more than one place.
[/quote]
1: depends how u want to open it. anyways main point you know where it is.
2: you can try that with opening 1 shop and then shop interface id with ::interface. It is just common PI bug, so try not to think about it.

Anyways OP:
Search for another interface that you want add with list from google or somewhere and test them with ::interface until u find good looking which you want to use.
then just swap the id and you’re done.[/quote]
I thought that i just explained myself above ^
When i just change the interface id, that it is supposed to open in commands.java for the ::news command. The interface i changed it to comes up blank without text.

Read full topic

item.title: PI - Switching Interfaces - Help appreciated
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

[quote=“Andersmulle2, post:3, topic:539837”][quote author=jake645 link=topic=658681.msg4405641#msg4405641 date=1391897725]
Just go into client.java server sided, find the text and replace the interface id.
[/quote]
1st of all, that would be in commands.java.
2nd of all, I have tryed that and the interface came up blank without the text.
But as soon as i did ::interface followed by the old interface id used, the text came up.
So I’m thinking that it has to be edited more than one place.[/quote]
1: depends how u want to open it. anyways main point you know where it is.
2: you can try that with opening 1 shop and then shop interface id with ::interface. It is just common PI bug, so try not to think about it.

Anyways OP:
Search for another interface that you want add with list from google or somewhere and test them with ::interface until u find good looking which you want to use.
then just swap the id and you’re done.

Read full topic
